text:
Congress leaders cried foul over what they termed a systematic attempt by the BJP to topple governments headed by the party in various States. “The duo of Modi and Shah is infamous for forcible eviction of elected governments. Elected governments are being destabilised by a sinister conspiracy. After Arunachal Pradesh, it is Uttarakhand,” All India Congress Committee general secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

He said the BJP was resorting to such actions in the backdrop of its debacle in the Delhi and Bihar Assembly polls, which “convinced” the party that it would not come to power in any State through a popular vote. The BJP dismissed the allegations. “If the Congress cannot keep its flock together, it is not the fault of the BJP,” Minister for Telecommunications Ravi Shankar Prasad said.

Kharge slams BJP

Meanwhile, Leader of the Congress in the Lok Sabha M. Mallikarjun Kharge in Kalaburagi has termed the political developments in the Congress-ruled Uttarakhand as yet another naked move by the BJP to destabilise the legitimately elected government by targeting the disgruntled legislators through inducement and other unlawful means.

He said that a frustrated BJP after its drubbing in the Bihar and subsequent byelections and obvious of the party’s likely defeat in the Assembly elections in West Bengal, Kerala, and Assam was indulging in undemocratic acts and this had continued after Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and now in Uttarakhand.

“Their next target is Himachal Pradesh”. Mr. Kharge said that this only exhibited the fascist mindset of the BJP which did not tolerate the Opposition-ruled States.

(With additional reporting by T.V. Sivanandan in Kalaburagi)
title: Rawat gets nine days to prove strength
